intro: Mesynium texense, commonly known as the Texas mesynium, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern regions of Texas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Mesynium texense is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
